```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(knitr)
library(ggplot2)
library(fontawesome) # from github: https://github.com/rstudio/fontawesome
options(
    htmltools.dir.version = FALSE,
    knitr.table.format = "html",
    knitr.kable.NA = ''
)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
    warning = FALSE,
    message = FALSE,
    comment = "#>",
    fig.retina = 3 # Better figure resolution
)
dateWritten <- format(as.Date('2020-05-04'), format="%B %d %Y")
today <- format(Sys.Date(), format="%B %d %Y")
```

```{r xaringan-tile-view, echo=FALSE}
# Enables the ability to show all slides in a tile overview by pressing "o"

xaringanExtra::use_tile_view()
```

# .center[Github code chunk highlighting]

.leftcol80[
```{r, error=TRUE}
# function args are keywords c; function names are keywords d
foo <- function(arg1 = 100, arg2 = "character string") {
  if (TRUE) {
    x = NULL  # if, function, NULL are keywords a
    for (i in 1:10) x = c(x, mean(3 * rnorm(100) + 1))
  }
}

1 + "a"  # error
```
]

# Images have a thin border by default

.leftcol60[
This code produces the image on the right:
```{r, eval=FALSE}
<img src="images/blue_ridge_sunset.jpg">
```
]
.rightcol40[
<img src="images/blue_ridge_sunset.jpg">
]

# Remove the border with `.noborder[]`

.leftcol60[
This code produces the image on the right:
```{r, eval=FALSE}
.noborder[ #<<
<img src="images/blue_ridge_sunset.jpg">
] #<<
```
]
.rightcol40[.noborder[
<img src="images/blue_ridge_sunset.jpg">
]]

# Image classes work on rendered charts too

.leftcol[
````markdown
.noborder[
`r ''````{r}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp)) +
    geom_point() +
    theme_bw() +
    labs(color = 'Cylinders')
```
]
````
.noborder[
```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.width=4, fig.height=3}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp)) +
    geom_point() +
    theme_bw() +
    labs(color = 'Cylinders')
```
]]
.rightcol[
````markdown
.circle[
`r ''````{r}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp)) +
